p: A recent study by O’Leary et al. [ 17] grouped L. origanoides × velutina, L. velutina, L. sidoides, and L. salviifolia, but not L. grata, within L. origanoides. Our results showed that individuals classified as L. origanoides, L. origanoides × velutina, L. velutina, L. sidoides, L. salviifolia, and L. grata formed a single group due to their strong genetic similarity, and therefore should be recognized as a single taxon to be named L. origanoides.
